Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RANATUERIN-2ONa (1S=S, XXU, natural AMPs; UCSS1; frog, amphibians, animals; inactive: RANATUERIN 8)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals highest similarity (89.7%) toRanatuerin-2CHa. Active against E. coli (MIC 50 uM), C. albicans (MIC 100 uM), HC50 90 uM.  RANATUERIN 8 with Very weak activity against Staph.aureus (MIC 130 uM) has been replaced. 7/2020
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Vaudry H, King JD. 2010
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol C Toxicol Pharmacol . 2010 Apr;151(3):313-7. doi: 10.1016/j.cbpc.2009.12.004.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Primary structures of skin antimicrobial peptides indicate a close, but not conspecific, phylogenetic relationship between the leopard frogs Lithobates onca and Lithobates yavapaiensis (Ranidae)
